title: Detect mobile-web-app-capable in metadata and provide app-like experience.
body: When <meta name="mobile-web-app-capable" content="yes"> is on the page, give the user cues that the site can be saved as an app. When opened as an app, provide minimal or no chrome to the user, and make any other web-app-specific UI/behavior changes.

comments.body: @Chris, while that's true, it would be nice to have support for this meta tag that other browsers use to avoid the MS-prefixed code that makes live tiles run. Alternately, it would be nice to have the live tile metadata be proposed as a non-browser-specific set of metadata so that other platforms beyond Windows could make use of it.
Internet Explorer supports live tiles and the Metro instance of the browser is full screen. You could also use the Full screen API to make the chrome go away.
